alert.note: Alert for Harding; Quay; San Miguel (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 26 at 5:14PM MDT until May 26 at 6:15PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... East central San Miguel County in northeastern New Mexico... Southeastern Harding County in northeastern New Mexico... West central Quay County in east central New Mexico... * Until 615 PM MDT. * At 514 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles west of Tucumcari, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Tucumcari. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 317 and 336. State Road 104 between Mile Markers 91 and 105. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for northeastern and east central New Mexico. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for northeastern and east central New Mexico.
